lines.text: Look, from now on, keep one eye on that candle, another eye on that one, and with the other eye watch me!
If you see a pair of pants go flyin' through the air, don't grab 'em.
Why not?
I'll be in 'em!
I called 42 Oh, Chucks and you didn't come in.
I came in as soon as you hollered "Oh, Chuck!"
From now on, don't wait for me to say "Oh, Chuck!" Get in here on the "Oh!"
You boys ready to leave?
I was ready to leave when he put the key in the front door to come in!
Are you a married man?
No.
Neither am I.
[to Chuck]
He's old enough, isn't he?
Oh sure I'm old enough, I play games, I play post office.
Post office? That's a kids' game.
Not the way I play.
Somebody blew out my candle!
That was the wind.
Since when does the wind eat garlic?

[after tasting the soup]
Like mother used to make... It stinks!

[Ferdie parks his car disasterously]
That man should have his license taken away.
I'll see that he does as soon as he gets one.
Somebody's trying to scare us out of this house.
Hey, what happened to those two detectives?
Maybe they're
[makes throat cutting noise]
You sure you never heard of me? Camille Brewster?
No.
You must have a cheap radio.
We were very close to Charlie Smith at the time of his demise.
He's all tied up and he's got a something in his mouth.
He had a gag in his mouth.
If he did he never got a chance to tell it.
What's on him, a cobweb?
It ain't a wedding veil.
Remember that stuff that took the enamel off your teeth?
Sure, once I had 6 bottles of that stuff, I didn't stagger.
Didn't stagger?
I couldn't move.

[to Camille]
With one eye, watch that candle, with the other eye watch the other candle, and with the other eye, watch me.

[to Chuck]
I was playing choo-choo train! Aww you never let me have any fun.

[looking at an old house with no paint]
What did I tell you, Chuck? Anyplace painted dark brown, I never liked it.
Is everybody happy?
What a tonsil.
[shouts]
What a tonsil!
Oh a bed, that's just what I need, a nice big bed to hide under.
Everything happens to you.
Everything except what happened to Charlie Smith.
When I said gone with the wind, I should've said never the twain shall meet.
What twain?
The twain on twat twee.
He's nothing but a rumor.
I don't care if he's the landlord...
